intro: Raoulia buchananii, commonly known as the white raoulia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and glossy, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Raoulia buchananii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
